summary: The 'Recharge your Electric Car on the Highway to Alleviate Range Gaps Effectively Act' (RECHARGE Act) amends Title 23 of the United States Code to allow electric vehicle charging stations at rest areas on the Interstate System. It directs the Secretary to permit charging infrastructure consistent with existing regulations. The bill also includes conforming amendments related to congestion mitigation programs and previous legislation, clarifying language regarding natural gas vehicle refueling and electric vehicle charging. The Act explicitly states that it does not alter existing Presidential or Federal agency authority under Title 23.
